sentence.Network_en: There were plenty of servants to wait on her.

sentence.Network_cn: 一条重要的原则就是每次坐飞机都要多喝水。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'fullness, perfection'): from Old French plente, from Latin plenitas, from plenus 'full'

entry.tran: （尤指足够的或超出需要的）丰富，充足，大量
entry.def: If there is plenty of something, there is a large amount of it. If there are plenty of things, there are many of them. Plenty is used especially to indicate that there is enough of something, or more than you need.

example.ex: There was still plenty of time to take Jill out for pizza...
example.tran: 还有充裕的时间带吉尔出去吃比萨饼。

example.ex: Most businesses face plenty of competition...
example.tran: 大多数企业面临着巨大的竞争压力。

entry.def: Plenty is a situation in which people have a lot to eat or a lot of money to live on.

example.ex: You are all fortunate to be growing up in a time of peace and plenty.
example.tran: 你们都很幸运，成长在和平富足的时代。

example.ex: ...an area that has become a symbol of despair in the midst of America's plenty.
example.tran: 在富庶的美国已成为绝望象征的一个地区

entry.tran: （用于形容词或副词前）非常，十分，很
entry.def: You use plenty in front of adjectives or adverbs to emphasize the degree of the quality they are describing.

example.ex: The compartment is plenty big enough...

entry.def: If there are things in plenty, those things exist or happen in large amounts or numbers.

example.ex: There were thrills in plenty on Saturday at Terrassa, where Germany won the gold medal...
example.tran: 周六的塔拉萨充满着紧张兴奋的气氛，德国队在此赢得了金牌。

example.ex: School inspectors visit regularly, finding everything satisfactory, books in plenty and five computer terminals.
example.tran: 督学定期进行检查，发现所有方面都令人满意，教材充足，还有5台计算机终端设备。

sentences.sentence: "there was plenty of food for everyone"

means.word_mean: 2. (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent;

sentences.sentence: "he made a mint on the stock market"
"Have I eaten enough?"; (`plenty' is nonstandard) "I've had plenty, thanks"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无限的、绝对的,充分的, 完全的
stems_affixes.word_buile: plen满,填满+ary……的→adj.无限的、绝对的,充分的, 完全的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 许多的, 大量的, 丰富的, 丰饶的
stems_affixes.word_buile: plenty丰富+ful表形容词→plentiful许多的, 大量的
plenty[n.丰富,大量]+itude状态→plentitude满的状态→充分
de去掉+plen满,填满+ish表动词→去掉满→倒空
re再+plen满,填满+ish表动词→再弄满

Sentence.sentence: They will include plenty of names no one has yet heard of.
There was plenty of room for improvement.
There are plenty of training courses in management techniques and committee work which you can attend now.
Mass layoffs and plant closings have drawn plenty of headlines and public debate over the years, and they still occasionally do.
Smith's book serves as an excellent introduction to a vast subject, and will suggest plenty of further

We think this is the way the future is going to work," said Kyle Dickson, co-director of research and the mobile learning initiative at Abilene Christian University in Texas, which has bought more than 600 iPhones and 300 iPods for students Although plenty of students take their laptops to class, they don't take them everywhere and would prefer something lighter

means.word_mean: 充裕, 大量, 富庶

sentences.en: They would have plenty to eat.
sentences.cn: 他们将会有充足的食物。
大伙听着, 我饿得很呀。

sentences.en: We've got plenty more in the shop.

jushi.english: In years of plenty everyone has enough to eat.
She gave us plenty to do.
